==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|ご|はん|yomi=on}}

===Etymology===
Compound of {{prefix|lang=ja|sort=こはん'|御|tr1=go|pos1=honorific prefix|飯|tr2=han|t2=cooked rice}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

===Pronunciation===
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|音読み|On'yomi}}
* {{ja-accent-common|a|ご|はん}}<ref name="DJR"/><ref name="NHK">{{R:NHK Hatsuon}}</ref>
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[ɡo̞hã̠ɴ]}}

===Alternative forms===
* {{ja-l|ご飯}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|ごはん}}

# [[cooked]] [[rice]]
# a [[meal]] of any sort

====Usage notes====
The honorific prefix {{ja-l|御||go}} is more commonly spelled in hiragana as {{ja-l|ご}}, due in part to the complexity of the character.

====Synonyms====
* {{sense|meal}} {{ja-r|食事|しょくじ}}, {{ja-r|めし}}

====Derived terms====
* {{ja-r|朝ご飯|あさごはん}}: breakfast
* {{ja-r|昼ご飯|ひるごはん}}: lunch
* {{ja-r|夕ご飯|ゆうごはん}}: dinner
